title: Community Development Grant - Small
amount: Up to $250,000 (covering up to 75% of project costs)
description: This program provides funding of up to $250,000 to support eligible commercial, mixed-use, and light manufacturing projects within the city of Chicago.
detailed_overview: The Community Development Grant - Small program is designed to stimulate economic activity by offering financial support for development projects. Grants are capped at $250,000 and can cover up to 75% of the total eligible project costs. The supported project types include commercial developments, mixed-use facilities, and light manufacturing operations, specifically covering costs associated with new construction.
eligibility: Intended to support eligible commercial, mixed-use, and light manufacturing projects. Specific organizational or applicant eligibility requirements are not detailed in the provided content.
application_requirements: Must be eligible commercial, mixed-use, or light manufacturing project
Check program resources and FAQs for detailed requirements

title: Capacity Building Grant
funder: Advocates for Urban Agriculture (AUA) in partnership with Food:Land:Opportunity (F.L.O.)
description: Funding to support urban farms and community gardens in the Chicago area, aimed at enriching the local food economy, production, and distribution.
detailed_overview: The Capacity Building Grant is a community-led resource distribution fund managed by Advocates for Urban Agriculture (AUA) in partnership with Food:Land:Opportunity (F.L.O.). It provides support to urban farms and community gardens throughout the Chicago area. Recipients are selected by an Advisory Committee composed of community residents, past grantees, growers, or supporters of earth stewardship. The 2025 grant cycle utilized a nomination process, allowing community members or the growing spaces themselves to nominate farms and gardens to reduce applicant administrative strain. Nominations are reviewed on a rolling basis, with funds typically awarded by mid-December.
eligibility: Urban farms and community gardens located throughout the Chicago area. Eligible entities include organizations and individuals who are growers or stewards of earth stewardship.
application_requirements: Completion of the Capacity Building Grant nomination form (via Google Form or document format via email)
Nomination must be submitted by the deadline (if a cycle is open)
